intro: Rondeletia guerrerensis, commonly known as the Guerrero rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for both ornamental and ecological studies.
